title: Reporting players for swearing?
body:
What are the rules around "Offensive language" and how can you determine what's offensive for one (which may not be offensive for another)?
I use cuss words when I game all the time.  Not in my day to day life unless I'm just with my mates, so what constitutes as "Offensive Language"?

If I say "What the F\*\*\*" clearly not offensive in the same way "what the hell" isn't.
So if I ask "What were you thinking", "What the hell were you thinking" and "What the f\*\*\* were you thinking" how can any of them be considered offensive when I am trying to show levels of frustration.

Now remember it's not abusive it's not name calling and it's not being racist or discriminatory which I would consider offensive.  Just as if some one said, "I main yas top I always win", my response would be "That's f\*\*\*ing bs, you're stats are 9/13/6" how is that offensive.  The way I see it, if you don't like cuss words, that's what the filter is for. If you disable it, you clearly cuss.

Some one tell me where this is in the rules that one cannot cuss in a sentence directed at another.  Cuz even when I'm on curse with my mates and gaming and they stuff up I'd have the same sentence format.

And please no "Salt" comments seriously I'm bronze I'll stay bronze and stay salty.

replies.body: Haha I get your point.  I swear all the time in chat but not to be offensive. When people report for swearing it's probably a young kid. Like for example when i get outplayed i just write "What the f@!#" but not being abusive to a player. Cussing in chat is normal, but being abusive is just wrong :)

Yeah well that's my thing. Like why do I get reported simply for saying "why the f#@% did you dive" or "what the f&*# was that?"
And if I stuff up I say. "Well I just f&*#ed up".
